column4: Anyone knows how we can Bitpim to work with a usb cable rather than a com port???
i believe usb ports (atleast in windows) create a "virtual com port"
well, i plugged the thing, nothing happened, installed Bitpim, didn't detect, installed MoPOL nothing happened
installed ubuntu and now you don't get a boot?
- i would say read up bitpim docs, see if u can make the usb port act as a virtual comp port
installed ubuntu after windows, and now windows wont boot
do you get the GRUB boot screen, or the machine jumps immediately to Ubuntu?

Vista is a lot less friendlier than XP when it comes to multiple boots, i would suggest GRUB's recovery CD, it would reinstall GRUB and fix the boot. But this very well could be a Vista incompatibility
is there a recovery CD or is it a floppy? :(

the recovery CD is very small, a few MBs only, and there is a floppy option and a USB option, but depending on some machine floppy and usb might not work. if you have a blank laying around the download isn't big at all
get the usb version then, different than the CD image
where do u see the usb version?
good luck and home it works, ciao
